      Needleman-Wunsch: a generalisation of edit distances Pointer was provided in Todd Hugues (Lockheed) Taken from http://www.merriampark.com/ldjava.htm Initial algorithm by Michael Gilleland Integrated in Apache Jakarta Commons Improved by Chas Emerick This algorithm should be taken appart of this file and reset in the context of a proper package name with an acceptable license terms.

      static double smoaDistance(String s1, String s2)
      smoaDistance = commonality - dissimilarity + winklerImprovement; A specialized distance for ontology matching identifiers Calls the string matching method proposed in the paper "A String Metric For Ontology Alignment", published in ISWC 2005 It is implemented in a separate class provided by the authors and available with this package
      static String stripQuotations(String s)
      Strips quotation within a string
      static double subStringDistance(String s1, String s2)
      subStringDistance computes substring distance: = 1 - (2 | length of longest common substring | / |s1|+|s2|) return: 0 if both string are equal, 1 otherwise
      static Vector<String> tokenize(String s)
      JE//: This should return a BagOfWords the new tokenizer first looks for non-alphanumeric chars in the string if any, they will be taken as the only delimiters otherwise the standard naming convention will be assumed: words start with a capital letter substring of capital letters will be seen as a whole if it is a suffix otherwise the last letter will be taken as the new token start Would be useful to parameterise with stop words as well

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • subStringDistance

        public static double subStringDistance(String s1,
                                       String s2)
        subStringDistance computes substring distance: = 1 - (2 | length of longest common substring | / |s1|+|s2|) return: 0 if both string are equal, 1 otherwise
        Parameters:
        s1 - and
        s2 - : two strings on which substring distance is computed
        Returns:
        the substring distance

      • jaroMeasure

        public static double jaroMeasure(String s,
                                 String t)
        jaroMeasure as a dissimilarity (identical have 0.) return: Original algorithm by Jérôme Euzenat. It traverses both strings at the same time finding the first match on s, then looking for the first on t (and deciding if there is transposition or not on the fly) before comming back to "s", etc. This is certainly minimal in lines of code if not optimal
        Parameters:
        s - and
        t: - two strings on which the Jaro measure is computed
        Returns:
        the Jaro measure between both strings

      • jaroWinklerMeasure

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • needlemanWunschDistance

        public static double needlemanWunschDistance(String s,
                                             String t,
                                             int gap)
        Needleman-Wunsch: a generalisation of edit distances Pointer was provided in Todd Hugues (Lockheed) Taken from http://www.merriampark.com/ldjava.htm Initial algorithm by Michael Gilleland Integrated in Apache Jakarta Commons Improved by Chas Emerick This algorithm should be taken appart of this file and reset in the context of a proper package name with an acceptable license terms. Hopefully, Jakarta Commons will provide this. Modified by Jérôme Euzenat for returning normalized distance. Modified again by Jérôme Euzenat for computing Needleman-Wunsch. Bugfix 2009-08-10 by Gerard de Melo fixing Needleman-Wunsch initialization.
        Parameters:
        s - and
        t: - two strings on which the Needleman-Wunsch distance is computed
        gap: - see the definition

      • smoaDistance

        public static double smoaDistance(String s1,
                                  String s2)
        smoaDistance = commonality - dissimilarity + winklerImprovement; A specialized distance for ontology matching identifiers Calls the string matching method proposed in the paper "A String Metric For Ontology Alignment", published in ISWC 2005 It is implemented in a separate class provided by the authors and available with this package
        Parameters:
        s1 - and
        s2: - two strings on which the Needleman-Wunsch distance is computed

      • stripQuotations

        public static String stripQuotations(String s)
        Strips quotation within a string
        Parameters:
        s - a String
        Returns:
        s without included quotations between ' or "

      • tokenize

        public static Vector<String> tokenize(String s)
        JE//: This should return a BagOfWords the new tokenizer first looks for non-alphanumeric chars in the string if any, they will be taken as the only delimiters otherwise the standard naming convention will be assumed: words start with a capital letter substring of capital letters will be seen as a whole if it is a suffix otherwise the last letter will be taken as the new token start Would be useful to parameterise with stop words as well
        Parameters:
        s: - a string to tokenize
        Returns:
        the tokenized string
